countrycode_alpha2.doc: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes are two-letter country codes defined in ISO 3166-1, part of the ISO 3166 standard published by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO), to represent countries, dependent territories, and special areas of geographical interest.
countrycode_alpha2.name: ISO 3166-1 Alpha2 country code

countrycode_alpha3.doc: ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 codes are three-letter country codes defined in ISO 3166-1, part of the ISO 3166 standard published by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO), to represent countries, dependent territories, and special areas of geographical interest.
countrycode_alpha3.name: ISO 3166-1 Alpha3 country code

countrycode_num.doc: ISO 3166-1 numeric (or numeric-3) codes are three-digit country codes defined in ISO 3166-1, part of the ISO 3166 standard published by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO), to represent countries, dependent territories, and special areas of geographical interest.
countrycode_num.name: ISO 3166-1 Numeric code (country code)

faalid.doc: The Federal Aviation Administration location identifier (FAA LID) is a three- to five-character alphanumeric code identifying aviation related facilities inside the United States, though some codes are reserved for, and are managed by other entities.
faalid.name: FAA airport code (FAA identifier)

ianatimezoneid.doc: Difference between Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and this timezone.
ianatimezoneid.name: IANA Timezone ID

iataairlinecode.doc: IATA airline designators, sometimes called IATA reservation codes, are two-character codes assigned by the International Air Transport Association (IATA) to the world's airlines.
iataairlinecode.name: IATA airline designator (airline code)

iataairportcode.doc: An IATA airport code, also known as an IATA location identifier, IATA station code, or simply a location identifier, is a three-letter geocode designating many airports and metropolitan areas around the world, defined by the International Air Transport Association (IATA)
iataairportcode.name: IATA Airport code

icaoairlinecode.doc: The ICAO airline designator is a code assigned by the International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) to aircraft operating agencies, aeronautical authorities, and services related to international aviation, each of which is allocated both a three-letter designator and a telephony designator.
icaoairlinecode.name: ICAO Airline code

icaoairportcode.doc: The ICAO airport code or location indicator is a four-letter code designating aerodromes around the world. These codes, as defined by the International Civil Aviation Organization and published in ICAO Document 7910: Location Indicators, are used by air traffic control and airline operations such as flight planning.
icaoairportcode.name: ICAO Airport code

utctimezoneoffset.doc: Difference between Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and this timezone.
utctimezoneoffset.name: UTC Timezone offset

encompanyname.doc: English written company/business/legal name of business entity
encompanyname.name: Company/business name in English

encountryname.doc: Name of the country in English
encountryname.name: Country name (English)

endayofweek.doc: Day of week writtern in English
endayofweek.name: Day of week (in English)

enmonthshort.doc: Abbreviated short English name/abbreviation of month
enmonthshort.name: Short name of month (English)

ukpostalcode.doc: Postal codes used in the United Kingdom, British Overseas Territories and Crown dependencies are known as postcodes (originally, postal codes).
ukpostalcode.name: UK Postal code

uszipcode.doc: A ZIP Code is a postal code used by the United States Postal Service (USPS). Introduced in 1963, the basic format consisted of five digits. In 1983, an extended ZIP+4 code was introduced; it included the five digits of the ZIP Code, followed by a hyphen and four digits that designated a more specific location.
uszipcode.name: US Postal code

frfullname.doc: Full name of the person written in French
frfullname.name: French full name of the person

ru.doc: Код валюты по справочнику ОКВ (Общероссийский классификатор валют)
ru.name: Код валюты по ОКВ

ru.doc: Название валюты по справочнику ОКВ (Общероссийский классификатор валют)
ru.name: Название валюты по ОКВ

rusbankaccount.doc: A bank account is a financial account maintained by a bank or other financial institution in which the financial transactions between the bank and a customer are recorded.
rusbankaccount.name: Bank account in Russia

ruscountryname.doc: Name of the country written in Russian language.
ruscountryname.name: Country name (Russian)

rusdayofweek.doc: Day of week written in Russian language
rusdayofweek.name: Day of week (in Russian)

rusfullname.doc: Fullname of the person in Russian
rusfullname.name: Fullname of the person in Russian

ruspostalcode.doc: 6 digits postal codes used in Russian Federation
ruspostalcode.name: Russian postal code

rusregioncode.doc: Russian unique code of country subdivision (regions/federal subjects)
rusregioncode.name: Russian region unique code

rusregionname.doc: Name of the region (federal subject) in Russia as it is in country Constitution
rusregionname.name: Russian region (federal subject) name

rustreet.doc: Street name writtern in Russian language
rustreet.name: Street name (Russian)

rusworkposition.doc: Work positions / job title common in Russia and written in Russian language.
rusworkposition.name: Work position / Job title (Russian)

molformula.doc: Molecular formulae indicate the simple numbers of each type of atom in a molecule of a molecular substance.
molformula.name: Molecular Formula

pubchemid.doc: PubChem is a database of chemical molecules and their activities against biological assays. The system is maintained by the National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI), a component of the National Library of Medicine, which is part of the United States National Institutes of Health (NIH).
pubchemid.name: PubChem Substance ID (SID)

ru.doc: Номер ООН, Номер UN или UN-идентификатор — четырёхзначное число, позволяющее определить опасность вещества или изделия (такого, например, как взрывчатое вещество, легковоспламеняющаяся жидкость, ядовитое вещество и др.)
ru.name: Код класса опасности ООН

boolean.doc: In computer science, the Boolean data type is a data type that has one of two possible values (usually denoted true and false) which is intended to represent the two truth values of logic and Boolean algebra.
boolean.name: Boolean

ru.doc: Логи́ческий тип да́нных, или булев тип, или булевый тип (от англ. Boolean или logical data type) — примитивный тип данных в информатике, принимающий два возможных значения, иногда называемых истиной (true) и ложью (false).
ru.name: Логический тип

email.doc: Electronic mail (email or e-mail) is a method of exchanging messages ("mail") between people using electronic devices. Email was thus conceived as the electronic (digital) version of, or counterpart to, mail, at a time when "mail" meant only physical mail (hence e- + mail).
email.name: Email (Electronic mail)

ru.doc: Электро́нная по́чта (англ. email, e-mail [iˈmeɪl], от англ. electronic mail) — технология и служба по пересылке и получению электронных сообщений (называемых «письма», «электронные письма» или «сообщения») между пользователями компьютерной сети (в том числе — Интернета).
ru.name: Электронная почта (email)

filename.doc: File name with common notation like somefile.ext
filename.name: Name of the file

ru.doc: Название файла в файловой системе
ru.name: Название файла

mimetype.doc: Mime type of the file/content. Used to identify contents of the stream or file. The MIME standard is specified in a series of requests for comments: RFC 2045, RFC 2046, RFC 2047, RFC 4288, RFC 4289 and RFC 2049.
mimetype.name: Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME)

mongodbid.doc: MongoDB unique id assigned to each row of each collection in MongoDB as field _id
mongodbid.name: MongoDB unique Object ID

phone.doc: Telephone number in standard format (RFC3966), without 'tel:' prefix
phone.name: Phone number

url.doc: A Uniform Resource Locator (URL), colloquially termed a web address, is a reference to a web resource that specifies its location on a computer network and a mechanism for retrieving it. A URL is a specific type of Uniform Resource Identifier (URI), although many people use the two terms interchangeably
url.name: Uniform Resource Locator (URL)

companyhouseid.doc: Numeric identifier for company registered with Companies House in the United Kingdom
companyhouseid.name: Companies House company ID (UK)

duns.doc: The Data Universal Numbering System, abbreviated as DUNS or D-U-N-S, is a proprietary system developed and managed by Dun & Bradstreet (D&B) that assigns a unique numeric identifier, referred to as a "DUNS number" to a single business entity. It was introduced in 1963 to support D&B's credit reporting practice.
duns.name: Data Universal Numbering System (DUNS)

inn.doc: Russian organization/person tax identification number (INN) is unique for each person and organization.
inn.name: INN (Russian tax identifier)

kpp.doc: Russian company supplemental registration code (KPP). Used in combination with Taxpayer INN code
kpp.name: Russian company supplemental registration code (KPP)

ru.doc: Вспомогательный код используемый вместе с кодом ИНН для идентификации налоговой принадлежности компании.
ru.name: Код постановки на учёт (КПП)

lei.doc: The Legal Entity Identifier (LEI) is a unique global identifier for legal entities participating in financial transactions. Also known as an LEI code or LEI number, its purpose is to help identify legal entities on a globally accessible database. Legal entities are organisations such as companies or government entities that participate in financial transactions. An individual person may not obtain an LEI.
lei.name: Legal Entity Identifier

ogrn.doc: Primary State Registration Number number assigned by Tax Service to any business entity in Russia
ogrn.name: Russian primary state registration number (OGRN)

ru.doc: ОГРН (основной государственный регистрационный номер) — государственный регистрационный номер записи о создании юридического лица либо записи о первом представлении в соответствии с федеральным законом Российской Федерации «О государственной регистрации юридических лиц» сведений о юридическом лице, зарегистрированном до введения в действие указанного Закона (пункт 8 Правил ведения Единого государственного реестра юридических лиц).
ru.name: Основной государственный регистрационный номер (ОГРН)

ogrn_ogrnip.doc: Russian primary government identification number assigned by Tax Service to any business entity (OGRN) in Russia and sole prprietors (OGRNIP)
ogrn_ogrnip.name: Russian primary government identification number (OGRN and OGRNIP)

ru.doc: Основной государственный регистрационный номер индивидуального предпринимателя или ОГРН (основной государственный регистрационный номер)
ru.name: Код ОГРН или ОГРНИП

okfs.doc: Russian classifier of forms of ownership, OKFS
okfs.name: Russian form of ownership code (OKFS)

ru.doc: ОКФС — это общероссийский классификатор форм собственности, входящий в Единую систему кодирования РФ
ru.name: Код ОКФС

okogu.doc: Russian government and governance code. OKOGU classifier
okogu.name: Russian government and governance code (OKOGU)

ru.doc: ОКОГУ -  это общероссийский классификатор органов государственной власти и управления
ru.name: Код ОКОГУ

okopf.doc: Code of type of business entity in Russia, classifier OKOPF
okopf.name: Code of type of business entity (Russian, OKOPF)

ru.doc: Код организационно-правовой формы юридического лица по справочнику ОКОПФ
ru.name: Код организационно-правовая формы по ОКОПФ

okopfname.doc: Type of business entity in Russia, classifier OKOPF
okopfname.name: Type of business entity (Russian, OKOPF)

ru.doc: Наименование организационно-правовой формы юридического лица по справочнику ОКОПФ
ru.name: Организационно-правовая форма

okpo.doc: Russian organizations statistical code (OKPO) issued by Rosstat
okpo.name: Russian organization stat code

ru.doc: Код по Общероссийскому классификатору предприятий и организаций
ru.name: Код ОКПО

opencorporatesid.doc: Identifier for a corporation, in the OpenCorporates database. Format: country prefix, optional subnational entity abbrevation, "/", alphanumeric idid: oid
opencorporatesid.name: Open Corporates ID

orgname.doc: Name of the organization/business/company in any language
orgname.name: Company name

patterns.doc: English written company/business/legal name of business entity
patterns.name: Company/business name in English

patterns.doc: Russian written company/business name
patterns.name: Company/business name in Russian

ruikuiko.doc: Unique code assigned to all government customers in Russian Federation
ruikuiko.name: Russian government customers unique code

ru.doc: Код присваиваемый государственным заказчикам в Российской Федерации
ru.name: Идентификационный код заказчика

ruikz.doc: Unique id assigned to all government procurement procedures in Russian Federation
ruikz.name: Russian government procurement unique id

ru.doc: Код присваиваемый государственным закупкам в Российской Федерации
ru.name: Идентификационный код закупки

sirencode.doc: SIREN codes are given to French businesses and nonprofit associations, SIRET codes to their establishments and facilities. SIREN codes are maintained by the French INSEE. This is France-specific, and will not change during the lifetime of the business.
sirencode.name: SIREN Code

bip32addr.doc: The BIP-32 mainly describes the way of building the hierarchical deterministic wallet basing on the BIP-39 features. What does it mean? BIP-32 is exactly explaining how the bitcoin master private key and the master chain code is being created from delivered by BIP-39 bitcoin seed. The bitcoin seed generated by BIP-39 is the base for generating deterministic and hierarchical deterministic wallets.
bip32addr.name: BIP-32 key

p2pkhaddr.doc: A Bitcoin address is only a hash, so the sender can't provide a full public key in scriptPubKey. When redeeming coins that have been sent to a Bitcoin address, the recipient provides both the signature and the public key. The script verifies that the provided public key does hash to the hash in scriptPubKey, and then it also checks the signature against the public key.
p2pkhaddr.name: Pubkey hash (P2PKH address)

p2shaddr.doc: Pay to script hash (P2SH) transactions were standardised in BIP 16. They allow transactions to be sent to a script hash (address starting with 3) instead of a public key hash (addresses starting with 1). To spend bitcoins sent via P2SH, the recipient must provide a script matching the script hash and data which makes the script evaluate to true.
p2shaddr.name: Script hash (P2SH address)

wifaddrcomp.doc: Wallet Import Format (WIF) is a standardized method for displaying Bitcoin private keys using the Base58Check encoding scheme. WIF format was standardized in order to allow all Bitcoin wallets to import and export private keys.
wifaddrcomp.name: WIF, compressed pubkey

wifaddruncomp.doc: Wallet Import Format (WIF) is a standardized method for displaying Bitcoin private keys using the Base58Check encoding scheme. WIF format was standardized in order to allow all Bitcoin wallets to import and export private keys.
wifaddruncomp.name: WIF, uncompressed pubkey

md5hash.doc: Result of the MD5 hash function. Commonly used to generate hash of from file or data or to use as unique identifier
md5hash.name: MD5 hash

sha1hash.doc: SHA-1 hash from file or data. Sometimes used as unique id of the data record
sha1hash.name: SHA-1 hash

sha256hash.doc: SHA256 hash from file or data. Sometimes used as unique id of the data record
sha256hash.name: SHA256 hash

age.doc: Age of the person or organization in years
age.name: Age

birthday.doc: A birthday is the anniversary of the birth of a person, or figuratively of an institution. Birthdays of people are celebrated in numerous cultures, often with birthday gifts, birthday cards, a birthday party, or a rite of passage.
birthday.name: Birthday

ru.doc: День рождения — годовщина рождения, соответствует дате рождения человека.
ru.name: День рождения

date.doc: Date with one of known notations
date.name: Date

ru.doc: Дата в одной из общепринятых нотаций
ru.name: Дата

datetime.doc: Date and time with one of known notations
datetime.name: Date and time

ru.doc: Дата и время в одной из общепринятых нотаций
ru.name: Дата и время

dayofmonth.doc: Month day, numeric value from 1 to 31
dayofmonth.name: Day of month

ru.doc: День месяца в значении от 1 до 31
ru.name: День месяца

patterns.doc: Day of week writtern in English
patterns.name: Day of week (in English)

patterns.doc: Day of week written in Russian language
patterns.name: Day of week (in Russian)

ru.doc: Название для недели
ru.name: День недели

deathday.doc: Date of death of the person
deathday.name: Date of death

ru.doc: Дата смерти человека
ru.name: Дата смерти

month.doc: Month as number since start of the year. Could be from 1 to 12
month.name: Month

patterns.doc: English name of the month
patterns.name: Month name (English)

patterns.doc: Abbreviated short English name/abbreviation of month
patterns.name: Short name of month (English)

time.doc: Time of the day, like 12:00 or 10PM or 11:05
time.name: Time

timerange.doc: Interval between two points of time, like 8:00-21:00 or 8:00AM-1:00PM
timerange.name: Time range

patterns.doc: Time range written in Russian
patterns.name: Time range (Russian)

timezone.doc: A time zone is an area that observes a uniform standard time for legal, commercial and social purposes
timezone.name: Time zone

patterns.doc: Difference between Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and this timezone.
patterns.name: IANA Timezone ID

patterns.doc: Difference between Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and this timezone.
patterns.name: UTC Timezone offset

unixtime.doc: Digital timestamp defined as Unix Time. It is a system for describing a point in time. It is the number of seconds that have elapsed since the Unix epoch, excluding leap seconds.
unixtime.name: Digital timestamp (Unix time, Epoch time, Posix time)

year.doc: A calendar year in western notation like 2022 or 1913
year.name: Year

bankaccount.doc: A bank account is a financial account maintained by a bank or other financial institution in which the financial transactions between the bank and a customer are recorded.
bankaccount.name: Bank account

patterns.doc: A bank account is a financial account maintained by a bank or other financial institution in which the financial transactions between the bank and a customer are recorded.
patterns.name: Bank account in Russia

ru.doc: Банковский счёт — счёт, открываемый банком юридическим или физическим лицам для их участия в безналичном денежном обороте и аккумулировании на счёте безналичных денежных средств для целевого использования.
ru.name: Банковский счет

bankcard.doc: A bank card is typically a plastic card issued by a bank to its clients that performs one or more of a number of services that relate to giving the client access to bank account.
bankcard.name: Bank card (credit/debit card)

ru.doc: Ба́нковская ка́рта (англ. bank card) — пластиковая, металлическая или виртуальная карта, обычно привязанная к одному или нескольким расчётным счетам в банке.
ru.name: Банковская карта

bik.doc: Russian bank identification code used as unique identifier of a credit organization (bank) and issued by Bank of Russia
bik.name: Russian bank identification code (BIK)

ru.doc: Банковский идентификационный код, БИК — уникальный идентификатор банка, используемый в платежных документах (платёжное поручение, аккредитив) на территории России. Классификатор БИКов ведёт Центробанк РФ (Банк России).
ru.name: Банковский идентификационный код

cficode.doc: ISO 10962, generally known as CFI (Classification of Financial Instruments) is a six-letter-code used in the financial services industry to classify and describe the structure and function of a financial instrument (in the form of security or contract). It is an international standard approved by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO)
cficode.name: Classification of Financial Instruments (ISO 10962)

examples.description: Nonstandard (flex) Commodity Future on an extraction resource with physical delivery

currency.doc: A currency in the most specific sense is money in any form when in use or circulation as a medium of exchange, especially circulating banknotes and coins.
currency.name: Currency

patterns.doc: ISO 4217 Currency code
patterns.name: ISO 4217 Currency code

patterns.doc: ISO 4217 Currency name
patterns.name: ISO 4217 Currency name

patterns.doc: Russian currency codes (OKV classifier)
patterns.name: Russian currency code

ru.doc: Код валюты по справочнику ОКВ (Общероссийский классификатор валют)
ru.name: Код валюты по ОКВ

patterns.doc: Russian currency names (OKV classifier)
patterns.name: Russian currency name

ru.doc: Название валюты по справочнику ОКВ (Общероссийский классификатор валют)
ru.name: Название валюты по ОКВ

cusip.doc: A CUSIP is a nine-digit numeric (e.g. 037833100 for Apple) or nine-character alphanumeric (e.g. 38259P508 for Google) code that identifies a North American financial security for the purposes of facilitating clearing and settlement of trades
cusip.name: CUSIP code

tickersymbol.doc: Ticker symbol or stock symbol is an abbreviation used to uniquely identify publicly traded shares of a particular stock on a particular stock market.
tickersymbol.name: Stock ticker symbol

isin.doc: An International Securities Identification Number (ISIN) uniquely identifies a security. Its structure is defined in ISO 6166. The ISIN code is a 12-character alphanumeric code that serves for uniform identification of a security through normalization of the assigned National Number, where one exists, at trading and settlement.
isin.name: International Securities Identification Number

miccode.doc: This International Standard specifies a universal method of identifying exchanges, trading platforms, regulated or non-regulated markets and trade reporting facilities as sources of prices and related information in order to facilitate automated processing
miccode.name: Market Identifier Code (ISO 10383)

examples.description: Bulgarian Stock Exchange - SME Growth Market Beam

ric.doc: A Reuters instrument code, or RIC, is a ticker-like code used by Refinitiv to identify financial instruments and indices. The codes are used for looking up information on various Refinitiv financial information networks (such as Refinitiv Real Time) and appear to have developed from the Quotron service purchased in the 1980s.
ric.name: Reuters Instrument Code (RIC)

examples.description: IBM being traded on the New York Stock Exchang
IBM being traded on London Stock Exchange

govlicaccount.doc: A personal account is an account for use by an individual for that persons own needs. It is a relative term to differentiate them from those accounts for business or corporate use. Used by Russian treasury for organizations accounts.
govlicaccount.name: Personal account for government budgets (Russian Treasury)

examples.description: Лицевой счет получателя бюджетных средствАДМИНИСТРАЦИЯ СЕВЕРНОГО РАЙОНА НОВОСИБИРСКОЙ ОБЛАСТИ
л/c для учета операций со средствами юридических лиц при казначейском сопровождении ООО "ПРОШКОЛА №13"

ru.doc: Лицевой счёт (англ. personal account) — бухгалтерский счёт для ведения учёта расчетов с физическими и юридическими лицами, на котором отражаются все финансово-кредитные операции с определенным клиентом, является документом аналитического учёта.
ru.name: Лицевой счет

rusecreg.doc: State registration number of the additional issue of equity securities (Russia) has 13 symbols
rusecreg.name: State registration number of the additional issue of equity securities (Russia)

examples.description: Обыкновенные акции закрытая подписка Публичное акционерное общество «Полюс»

ru.doc: Государственный   регистрационный  номер  дополнительного выпуска  эмиссионных  ценных  бумаг  состоит  из   государственного регистрационного  номера,  присвоенного  выпуску эмиссионных ценных бумаг,  и  индивидуального  номера  (кода)  этого   дополнительного выпуска эмиссионных ценных бумаг
ru.name: Государственный регистрационный номер дополнительного выпуска эмиссионных ценных бумаг

rueqsecreg.doc: State registration number of the issue of equity securities (Russia) has 9 symbols
rueqsecreg.name: State registration number of the issue of equity securities (Russia)

ru.doc: Государственный регистрационный номер - цифровой (буквенный, знаковый) код, идентифицирующий конкретный выпуск эмиссионных ценных бумаг, - состоит из девяти разрядов.
ru.name: Государственный регистрационный номер выпуска эмиссионных ценных бумаг

swiftcode.doc: ISO 9362 defines a standard format of Business Identifier Codes (also known as SWIFT-BIC, BIC, SWIFT ID or SWIFT code) approved by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO).
swiftcode.name: Bank SWIFT code (ISO 9362)

address.doc: Geographic address, commonly consist of postindex, country, area, town, street and building
address.name: Address (physical location)

ru.doc: Географический или административный адрес местонахождения. Может включать почтовый индекс, название страны, региона, города, улицы и здания.
ru.name: Адрес (физическое местонахождение)

city.doc: A city is a large human settlement. It can be defined as a permanent and densely settled place with administratively defined boundaries whose members work primarily on non-agricultural tasks.
city.name: City

patterns.doc: United States city name
patterns.name: United States city

patterns.doc: City name in Russian language
patterns.name: City name (Russian)

ru.doc: Го́род — крупный населённый пункт, жители которого заняты, как правило, не сельским хозяйством.
ru.name: Город

country.doc: A country is a distinct territorial body or political entity. It may be an independent sovereign state or part of a larger state,[2] as a non-sovereign or formerly sovereign political division, a physical territory with a government, or a geographic region associated with sets of previously independent or differently associated peoples with distinct political characteristics.
country.name: Country code or name

patterns.doc: ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 codes are two-letter country codes defined in ISO 3166-1, part of the ISO 3166 standard published by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO), to represent countries, dependent territories, and special areas of geographical interest.
patterns.name: ISO 3166-1 Alpha2 country code

patterns.doc: ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 codes are three-letter country codes defined in ISO 3166-1, part of the ISO 3166 standard published by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO), to represent countries, dependent territories, and special areas of geographical interest.
patterns.name: ISO 3166-1 Alpha3 country code

patterns.doc: ISO 3166-1 numeric (or numeric-3) codes are three-digit country codes defined in ISO 3166-1, part of the ISO 3166 standard published by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO), to represent countries, dependent territories, and special areas of geographical interest.
patterns.name: ISO 3166-1 Numeric code (country code)

patterns.doc: Name of the country in English
patterns.name: Country name (English)

patterns.doc: Name of the country written in Russian language.
patterns.name: Country name (Russian)

ru.doc: Страна — территория, имеющая политические, физико-географические, культурные или исторические границы, которые могут быть как чётко определёнными и зафиксированными, так и размытыми (в таком случае нередко говорят не о границах, а о «рубежах»).
ru.name: Название или код страны

epcicode.doc: Etablissements publics de cooperation intercommunale (EPCI). French administrative geo code
epcicode.name: Etablissements publics de cooperation intercommunale (EPCI)

eucin.doc: The Craft Identification Number (CIN) or Hull Identification Number (HIN), standardised as EN ISO 10087:2006, is a permanent unique fourteen-digit alphanumeric identifier issued to all marine vessels in Europe.
eucin.name: Craft Identification Number

fips52.doc: Two-digit identifier for US states and other associated areas per former Federal Information Processing Standard FIPS 5-2 standard
fips52.name: FIPS 5-2 numeric code (US states)

fips64.doc: Identifier for US entities (mostly counties) per "Federal Information Processing Series" (FIPS 6-4), used for counties, Puerto Rico zona urbana, Metropolitan Statistical Areas (MSA) and Combined Statistical Areas (CSA) in the United States.
fips64.name: FIPS 6-4 numeric code (US counties)

geonamesid.doc: identifier in the GeoNames geographical database
geonamesid.name: Geonames ID

geopoint.doc: Geographic point as string, or dict, or array with latitude and longitude
geopoint.name: Geopoint

inseecode.doc: The INSEE code is a numerical indexing code used by the French National Institute for Statistics and Economic Studies (INSEE) to identify various entities, including communes and départements.
inseecode.name: INSEE code

iso3166code.doc: identifier for a country subdivision per ISO 3166-2 (include country code)
iso3166code.name: identifier for a country subdivision per ISO 3166-2

kladr.doc: Russian unique codes assigned by Government Tax Service for every administrative address in Russian federation. Replaces by FIAS government system
kladr.name: KLADR code (Russian)

ru.doc: КЛАДР — ведомственный классификатор ФНС России, созданный для распределения территорий между налоговыми инспекциями и автоматизированной рассылки корреспонденции. Заменен системой ФИАС
ru.name: Код КЛАДР

languagetag.doc: An IETF BCP 47 language tag is a standardized code or tag that is used to identify human languages in the Internet. The tag structure has been standardized by the Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF) in Best Current Practice (BCP) 47; the subtags are maintained by the IANA Language Subtag Registry.
languagetag.name: IETF language tag

ru.doc: Языковой код/тэг по стандарту IETF BCP 47 идентифицирующий конкретный человеческий язык, стиль написания и тд.
ru.name: Языковой код IETF

latitude.doc: In geography, latitude is a geographic coordinate that specifies the north–south position of a point on the Earths surface. Latitude is an angle (defined below) which ranges from 0° at the Equator to 90° (North or South) at the poles.
latitude.name: Latitude

longitude.doc: Longitude is a geographic coordinate that specifies the east–west position of a point on the Earths surface, or the surface of a celestial body. It is an angular measurement, usually expressed in degrees and denoted by the Greek letter lambda (λ)
longitude.name: Longitude

okato.doc: Russian Classification on Objects of Administrative Division (Russian: Общеросси́йский классифика́тор объе́ктов администрати́вно-территориа́льного деле́ния), or OKATO (Russian: ОКАТО), also called All-Russian classification on units of administrative and territorial distribution in English, is one of several Russian national registers. OKATOs purpose is organization of information about structure of the administrative divisions of the federal subjects of Russia.
okato.name: OKATO (Russian Classification on Objects of Administrative Division)

ru.doc: Общероссийский классификатор объектов административно-территориального деления (сокращ. ОКАТО — общероссийский классификатор административно-территориальных образований) — классификатор объектов административно-территориального деления Российской Федерации, входит в состав «Единой системы классификации и кодирования технико-экономической и социальной информации Российской Федерации» (ЕСКК). ОКАТО предназначен для обеспечения достоверности, сопоставимости и автоматизированной обработки информации в разрезах административно-территориального деления в таких сферах, как статистика, экономика и другие.
ru.name: Код ОКАТО

oktmo.doc: Russian Classification of Territories of Municipal Formations (Russian: Общероссийский классификатор территорий муниципальных образований), or OKTMO (Russian: ОКТМО), is one of several Russian national registers. OKTMO organizes information about the structure of the municipal divisions of Russia.
oktmo.name: Russian Classification of Territories of Municipal Formations (OKTMO) code

ru.doc: Общероссийский классификатор территорий муниципальных образований (сокращ. ОКТМО) — классификатор объектов административно-территориального деления Российской Федерации, входит в состав «Единой системы классификации и кодирования технико-экономической и социальной информации Российской Федерации» (ЕСКК).
ru.name: Код ОКТМО

oktmoname.doc: Russian Classification of Territories of Municipal Formations (Russian: Общероссийский классификатор территорий муниципальных образований), or OKTMO (Russian: ОКТМО), is one of several Russian national registers. OKTMO organizes information about the structure of the municipal divisions of Russia.
oktmoname.name: Russian Classification of Territories of Municipal Formations (OKTMO) name

ru.doc: Общероссийский классификатор территорий муниципальных образований (сокращ. ОКТМО) — классификатор объектов административно-территориального деления Российской Федерации, входит в состав «Единой системы классификации и кодирования технико-экономической и социальной информации Российской Федерации» (ЕСКК).
ru.name: Наименование из справочника ОКТМО

postindex.doc: Postal index/code, unique post identifier used in address
postindex.name: Postal code/index

patterns.doc: Postal codes used in the United Kingdom, British Overseas Territories and Crown dependencies are known as postcodes (originally, postal codes).
patterns.name: UK Postal code

patterns.doc: A ZIP Code is a postal code used by the United States Postal Service (USPS). Introduced in 1963, the basic format consisted of five digits. In 1983, an extended ZIP+4 code was introduced; it included the five digits of the ZIP Code, followed by a hyphen and four digits that designated a more specific location.
patterns.name: US Postal code

patterns.doc: Spanish postal code (by language)
patterns.name: Spanish postal code (by language)

patterns.doc: French postal code
patterns.name: French postal code

patterns.doc: 6 digits postal codes used in Russian Federation
patterns.name: Russian postal code

ru.doc: Индекс почтовой связи
ru.name: Почтовый индекс

rukadastr.doc: Russian land registry number (kadastroviy nomer, cadaster number) assigned to each land, territory, building and other geographic administrative objects by Rosreestr
rukadastr.name: Russian land registry number

ru.doc: Када́стровый но́мер — уникальный номер объекта недвижимости, присваиваемый ему при осуществлении кадастрового и технического учёта.
ru.name: Кадастровый номер

ru.doc: Справочник районов города Москвы
ru.name: Районы города Москвы

ru.doc: Округа города Москвы
ru.name: Округа города Москвы

rusfeddistrict.doc: Name of the federal district of Russia. Full or short.
rusfeddistrict.name: Russian federal district name

ru.doc: Наименование федерального округа России полное или сокращённое
ru.name: Наименование федерального округа России

rusregion.doc: Code or name of the region (federal subject) in Russia as it is in country Constitution
rusregion.name: Russian region (federal subject) coce or name

patterns.doc: Russian unique code of country subdivision (regions/federal subjects)
patterns.name: Russian region unique code

patterns.doc: Name of the region (federal subject) in Russia as it is in country Constitution
patterns.name: Russian region (federal subject) name

ru.doc: Код или наименование субъекта Российской Федерации по Конституции страны
ru.name: Код или наименование субъекта Российской Федерации

siretcode.doc: The SIRET code (French: Système d’identification du répertoire des établissements), or SIRET number,[1] is an INSEE code which allows the geographic identification of any French establishment or business.
siretcode.name: SIRET Code

street.doc: Name of the street, commonly used in address
street.name: Street

patterns.doc: Street name written in Russn
patterns.name: Street name in Russian

patterns.doc: Street name writtern in Russian language
patterns.name: Street name (Russian)

ukwardcode.doc: The wards and electoral divisions in the United Kingdom are electoral districts at sub-national level represented by one or more councillors.
ukwardcode.name: Ward code (United Kingdom)

ukwardname.doc: The wards and electoral divisions in the United Kingdom are electoral districts at sub-national level represented by one or more councillors.
ukwardname.name: Ward name (United Kingdom)

unlocode.doc: N/LOCODE, the United Nations Code for Trade and Transport Locations, is a geographic coding scheme developed and maintained by United Nations Economic Commission for Europe (UNECE). UN/LOCODE assigns codes to locations used in trade and transport with functions such as seaports, rail and road terminals, airports, Postal Exchange Office and border crossing points. The first issue in 1981 contained codes for 8,000 locations. The version from 2011 contained codes for about 82,000 locations.
unlocode.name: UN/LOCODE

uscounty.doc: Name or code of US County
uscounty.name: US County

usstate.doc: Name or code of US State
usstate.name: US State

budgetcode.doc: Budget codes issued by Ministry of Finances and Federal Treasury of Russia to all government and local budgets.
budgetcode.name: Russian government budget code

ru.doc: Уникальный код, присваеваемый каждому отдельному бюджету: федеральному, субъекта федерации и муниципалитету в Российской Федерации.
ru.name: Код бюджета

budgetname.doc: Name of the budget of Russian government at federal, regional or local level
budgetname.name: Russian government budget name

ru.doc: Название бюджета по справочнику наименований и кодов бюджета ведомом Минфином России и Федеральным казначейством.
ru.name: Наименование бюджета

cfdanumber.doc: CFDA numbers are the system for identifying and sorting the 2,000+ federal programs. Each CFDA number contains five digits and appears in the following format: ##.### (e.g., 10.001 or 98.102).
cfdanumber.name: The Catalog of Federal Domestic Assistance (CFDA) number

fedgrbs.name: Russian direct government budget receiver and distributor code

kbk.doc: Russian budget classification code KBK (kod byudzhetnoy klassifikacii) identifiers certain budget allocation of the federal or regional budget
kbk.name: Russian budget classification code (KBK)

ru.doc: Код бюджетной классификации (КБК) используется в бюджетной системе РФ для идентификации конкретной строки расхода федерального или регионального государственного бюджета.
ru.name: Код бюджетной классификации (КБК)

kosgucode.doc: Russian Public Administration Sector Classification Code (KOSGU) used in Russian budget planning and procurement
kosgucode.name: Russian Public Administration Sector Classification Code (KOSGU)

ru.name: Код КОСГУ

kvrcode.doc: Russian budget expense type code (KVR) used in budget planning and procurement
kvrcode.name: Russian budget expense type code (KVR)

ppocode.name: Russian public legal formation code

ru.doc: Публично правовое образование - это организация/субъект федерации с правом распоряжения бюджетом своего уровня
ru.name: Наименование публично правового образования в РФ

rnfi.doc: Russian government federal property unique ID (RNFI)
rnfi.name: Russian government property ID (RNFI)

runpa.doc: Russian regulatory legal act. For example: Executive order
runpa.name: Russian regulatory legal act

ru.doc: Нормативно-правовой документ в России. Например, постановление правительства
ru.name: Нормативно-правовой документ

runpakind.doc: Type of the Russian legal document: order, executive order and so on
runpakind.name: Russian regulatory legal act type

ru.doc: Тип нормативного документа, например: указ, постановление, приказ
ru.name: Тип нормативного документа

tofkcode.doc: Unique id of the Russian Federal treasury division.
tofkcode.name: Russian Federal treasury division code

ru.doc: Код территориального управления Федерального казначейства РФ. Синхронизовано с наименованием территориального управления, ведомственный справочник.
ru.name: Код территориального управления Федерального казначейства РФ

tofkname.doc: Name of the Russian Federal treasury division
tofkname.name: Russian Federal treasury division name

ru.doc: Наименование территориального управления Федерального казначейства РФ. Синхронизовано с кодом территориального управления, ведомственный справочник.
ru.name: Наименование территориального управления Федерального казначейства РФ

usfain.doc: FAIN (Federal Award Identification Number) is the unique identifying number assigned to all federal finance awards. Since October of 2013, the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) has required all Federal Agencies to issue a FAIN to all financial assistance awards or grants.
usfain.name: Federal Award Identification Number (FAIN)

uspiid.doc: The PIID consists of a combination of thirteen to seventeen alpha and/or numeric characters sequenced to convey certain information
uspiid.name: Procurement Instrument Identifier (PIID)

gtin.doc: The Global Trade Item Number (GTIN) is an identifier for trade items, developed by the international organization GS1.Such identifiers are used to look up product information in a database (often by entering the number through a barcode scanner pointed at an actual product) which may belong to a retailer, manufacturer, collector, researcher, or other entity. The uniqueness and universality of the identifier is useful in establishing which product in one database corresponds to which product in another database, especially across organizational boundaries.
gtin.name: Global Trade Item Number

gtin02.doc: The Global Trade Item Number (GTIN) is an identifier for trade items, developed by the international organization GS1.Such identifiers are used to look up product information in a database (often by entering the number through a barcode scanner pointed at an actual product) which may belong to a retailer, manufacturer, collector, researcher, or other entity. The uniqueness and universality of the identifier is useful in establishing which product in one database corresponds to which product in another database, especially across organizational boundaries.
gtin02.name: Global Trade Item Number (GTIN) of contained trade items

sssc.doc: The Serial Shipping Container Code (SSCC) is an 18-digit number used to identify logistics units. In order to automate the reading process, the SSCC is often encoded in a barcode, generally GS1-128, and can also be encoded in an RFID tag. It is used in electronic commerce transactions.
sssc.name: Serial shipping container code

guid.doc: A universally unique identifier (UUID) is a 128-bit label used for information in computer systems. The term globally unique identifier (GUID) is also used.
guid.name: GUID (Globally unique identifier)

uuid.doc: A universally unique identifier (UUID) is a 128-bit label used for information in computer systems. The term globally unique identifier (GUID) is also used.
uuid.name: A universally unique identifier (UUID)

isicrev4.doc: Code of industry by ISIC (International Standard Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities)
isicrev4.name: ISIC rev 4 class code

naicscode.doc: Classification in the North American Industry Classification System
naicscode.name: NAICS code

okei.doc: Russian OKEI (classifier of units of measurement)
okei.name: Russian OKEI code (classifier of units of measurement)

ru.doc: Общероссийский классификатор единиц измерения — это общероссийский классификатор, предназначенный для использования при решении задач количественной оценки технико-экономических и социальных показателей в целях осуществления государственного учета и отчетности, анализа и прогнозирования развития экономики, обеспечения международных статистических сопоставлений, осуществления внутренней и внешней торговли, государственного регулирования внешнеэкономической деятельности и организации таможенного контроля.
ru.name: Код ОКЕИ (Общероссийский классификатор единиц измерения)

okeiname.doc: Russian OKEI (classifier of units of measurement)
okeiname.name: Russian OKEI name of code (classifier of units of measurement)

ru.doc: Общероссийский классификатор единиц измерения — это общероссийский классификатор, предназначенный для использования при решении задач количественной оценки технико-экономических и социальных показателей в целях осуществления государственного учета и отчетности, анализа и прогнозирования развития экономики, обеспечения международных статистических сопоставлений, осуществления внутренней и внешней торговли, государственного регулирования внешнеэкономической деятельности и организации таможенного контроля.
ru.name: Наименование кода по ОКЕИ (Общероссийский классификатор единиц измерения)

okpd.name: Russian product code (OKPD)

ru.doc: Код по Общероссийскому классификатору продукции
ru.name: Код ОКПД

ru.doc: Код по общероссийскому классификатору видов экономической деятельности
ru.name: Код ОКВЭД

tnved.doc: TN VED is a Russian classifier used to identify product groups for customs purposes and international trade statistics.
tnved.name: Russian TN VED code (product code)

examples.description: Line pipe of a kind used for oil or gas pipelines, seamless, of stainless steel
Parts of machinery of heading 8428, n.e.s.

ru.doc: Товарная номенклатура внешнеэкономической деятельности Евразийского экономического союза
ru.name: Код ТНВЭД

domainname.doc: A domain name is an identification string that defines a realm of administrative autonomy, authority or control within the Internet.
domainname.name: Internet domain name

eui48.doc: A media access control address (MAC address) is a unique identifier assigned to a network interface controller (NIC) for use as a network address in communications within a network segment.
eui48.name: MAC Address (EUI48) of the device

ipaddr.doc: Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) or Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6) address
ipaddr.name: IPv4 or IPv6 address

ipsubnet.doc: Subnetwork of IPv4 or IPv6 addresses
ipsubnet.name: IPv4 or IPv6 subnet

ipv4.doc: Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4) is the fourth version of the Internet Protocol (IP). It is one of the core protocols of standards-based internetworking methods in the Internet and other packet-switched networks.
ipv4.name: Internet Protocol version 4 (IPv4)

ipv6.doc: Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6) is the most recent version of the Internet Protocol (IP), the communications protocol that provides an identification and location system for computers on networks and routes traffic across the Internet.
ipv6.name: Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6)

tld.doc: A top-level domain (TLD) is one of the domains at the highest level in the hierarchical Domain Name System of the Internet after the root domain.[10] The top-level domain names are installed in the root zone of the name space.
tld.name: Top level domain (TLD)

atccode.doc: The Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical (ATC) Classification System is a drug classification system that classifies the active ingredients of drugs according to the organ or system on which they act and their therapeutic, pharmacological and chemical properties. Its purpose is an aid to monitor drug use and for research to improve quality medication use. It does not imply drug recommendation or efficacy.
atccode.name: Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical (ATC) Classification System

ru.doc: Анатомо-терапевтическо-химическая классификация — международная система классификации лекарственных средств.
ru.name: Анатомо-терапевтическо-химическая классификация (АТХ)

ru.doc: Код регистрации лекарственного средства в России. Реестр Росздравнадзора
ru.name: Код регистрации лекарственного средства в России

rumedicinetradename.doc: Trade name of the medicine in Russian.
rumedicinetradename.name: Medicine trade name (Russian)

ru.doc: Торговое название для лекарственных средств
ru.name: Торговое наименование лекарственного средства

rumedmnn.doc: An international nonproprietary name (INN) is an official generic and non-proprietary name given to a pharmaceutical drug or an active ingredient. (Russian)
rumedmnn.name: International nonproprietary name (Russia)

ru.doc: Международное непатентованное наименование (МНН) — уникальное наименование действующего вещества лекарственного средства, рекомендованное Всемирной организацией здравоохранения (ВОЗ).
ru.name: Международное непатентованное наименование

ukbnfcode.doc: The British National Formulary (BNF) is a reference book containing the standard list of medicines used in UK prescribing. It gives information on the indications, dosages and side effects for over 70,000 medicines.
ukbnfcode.name: BNF code

isbn10.doc: The International Standard Book Number (ISBN) is a numeric commercial book identifier that is intended to be unique. Publishers purchase ISBNs from an affiliate of the International ISBN Agency
isbn10.name: International Standard Book Number 10-digits (ISBN10)

examples.description: Dolle mythes : een frisse factcheck van feminisme toen en nu

isbn13.doc: The International Standard Book Number (ISBN) is a numeric commercial book identifier that is intended to be unique. Publishers purchase ISBNs from an affiliate of the International ISBN Agency
isbn13.name: International Standard Book Number 13-digits (ISBN13)

ocn.doc: OCLC assigns a unique control number (referred to as an "OCN" for "OCLC Control Number") to each new bibliographic record in the WorldCat. Numbers are assigned serially, and as of mid-2013 over a billion OCNs had been created. In September 2013, the OCLC declared these numbers to be in the public domain, removing a perceived barrier to widespread use of OCNs outside OCLC itself.[42] The control numbers link WorldCat's records to local library system records by providing a common reference key for a record across libraries
ocn.name: OCLC Control Number

oid.doc: In computing, object identifiers or OIDs are an identifier mechanism standardized by the International Telecommunication Union (ITU) and ISO/IEC for naming any object, concept, or "thing" with a globally unambiguous persistent name.[1]
oid.name: ITU/ISO/IEC object identifier (OID)

openlibid.doc: Identifier for a work ("W"), edition ("M") or author ("A") for book data of the Internet Archive
openlibid.name: Open Library ID

viafid.doc: Identifier for the Virtual International Authority File database [format: up to 22 digits]
viafid.name: VIAF ID

wikidataid.doc: Wikidata makes use of identifiers for both internal organization of the knowledge base and for its connection to other databases.
wikidataid.name: Wikidata Id

gender.doc: Gender flag and/or any other identification value
gender.name: Gender

patterns.doc: Work positions / job title common in Russia and written in Russian language.
patterns.name: Work position / Job title (Russian)

ru.doc: Должность персоны в организации
ru.name: Должность

nationality.doc: Nationality of the person from list of unique code from one of code lists or defined somehow else.
nationality.name: Person nationality

passport.doc: Person passport, usually unique personal information that should be shared online. Identifies personal document issued to person by government authority
passport.name: Person passport number (universal)

patterns.doc: Number of Russian internal passport
patterns.name: Russian passport number

person_firstname.doc: First name of the person. For example, Donald or Vladimir or Jack
person_firstname.name: Person firstname

patterns.doc: First name in Russian
patterns.name: First name in Russian

person_fullname.doc: Full name of the person as combination of last, first, and sometimes middle name
person_fullname.name: Person fullname

patterns.doc: Full name of the person written in French
patterns.name: French full name of the person

patterns.doc: Fullname of the person in Russian
patterns.name: Fullname of the person in Russian

patterns.doc: Middle name in Russian
patterns.name: Middle name in Russian

person_surname.doc: Last name of the person. For example, Smith or Ivanova
person_surname.name: Person surname/lastname

patterns.doc: Surname/Lastname in Russian
patterns.name: Surname/Lastname in Russian

rusnils.doc: Russian social insurance identifier. Issued for every insured person by Pension fund of Russia
rusnils.name: Individual insurance account number (SNILS)

ru.doc: Страховой номер индивидуального лицевого счёта физического лица (СНИЛС)
ru.name: Код СНИЛС

uknino.doc: The National Insurance number is a number used in the United Kingdom in the administration of the National Insurance or social security system. It is also used for some purposes in the UK tax system.
uknino.name: National Insurance number

username.doc: Name of the user or login, commonly used for authentication or user identification purposes
username.name: Username

usssn.doc: In the United States, a Social Security number (SSN) is a nine-digit number issued to U.S. citizens, permanent residents, and temporary (working) residents under section 205(c)(2) of the Social Security Act, codified as 42 U.S.C. § 405(c)(2)
usssn.name: US Social Security Number

patterns.doc: Academic degree title in Russian.
patterns.name: Academic degree (Russian)

ru.doc: Научная степень персоны на русском языке. Например, кандидат технических наук
ru.name: Научная степень (на русском)

doi.doc: A digital object identifier (DOI) is a persistent identifier or handle used to identify objects uniquely, standardized by the International Organization for Standardization (ISO).
doi.name: Digital Object Identifier (DOI)

ru.doc: Цифровой идентификатор объекта (англ. digital object identifier (DOI), дискретный объекта идентификатор (ДОИ)) — основной элемент системы ДОИ, предназначенной для обозначения объектов информационной деятельности.
ru.name: Цифровой идентификатор объекта (DOI)

grid.doc: Global Research Identifier Database (GRID) is a database of educational and research organizations worldwide, created and maintained by Digital Science & Research Solutions Ltd., part of the technology company Digital Science.
grid.name: Global Research Identifier

examples.description: Republic of Korea National Red Cross

isni.doc: The International Standard Name Identifier (ISNI) is an identifier system for uniquely identifying the public identities of contributors to media content such as books, television programmes, and newspaper articles. Such an identifier consists of 16 digits. It can optionally be displayed as divided into four blocks.
isni.name: International Standard Name Identifier

orcid.doc: The ORCID, Open Researcher and Contributor ID) is a nonproprietary alphanumeric code to uniquely identify authors and contributors of scholarly communication as well as ORCIDs website and services to look up authors and their bibliographic output (and other user-supplied pieces of information).
orcid.name: Open Researcher and Contributor ID (ORCID)

researcherid.doc: ResearcherID is an identifying system for scientific authors. The system was introduced in January 2008 by Thomson Reuters.
researcherid.name: ResearcherID

rorid.doc: Research Organization Registry (ROR) is a community-led database that aims to provide a persistent identifier for every research institution in the world.[1] It complements other commonly used identifiers such as ORCID for researchers and DOI for research output.
rorid.name: ROR Identifier (ROR ID)

scopusauthoirid.doc: identifier for an author assigned in Scopus bibliographic database
scopusauthoirid.name: Scopus author ID

udkindex.doc: The Universal Decimal Classification (UDC) is a bibliographic and library classification representing the systematic arrangement of all branches of human knowledge organized as a coherent system in which knowledge fields are related and inter-linked.
udkindex.name: Universal Decimal Classification (UDC)

ru.doc: Универса́льная десяти́чная классифика́ция — система классификации информации, широко используется во всём мире для систематизации произведений науки, литературы и искусства, периодической печати, различных видов документов и организации картотек.
ru.name: Индекс УДК (универсальная десятичная классификация)

aircraftnumber.doc: An aircraft registration, alternatively called a tail number, is a code unique to a single aircraft, required by international convention to be marked on the exterior of every civil aircraft.
aircraftnumber.name: Aircraft/tail number

airlinecode.doc: Unique code of the airline provided by IATA or ICAP
airlinecode.name: Airline code

patterns.doc: IATA airline designators, sometimes called IATA reservation codes, are two-character codes assigned by the International Air Transport Association (IATA) to the world's airlines.
patterns.name: IATA airline designator (airline code)

patterns.doc: The ICAO airline designator is a code assigned by the International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) to aircraft operating agencies, aeronautical authorities, and services related to international aviation, each of which is allocated both a three-letter designator and a telephony designator.
patterns.name: ICAO Airline code

airport.doc: A location identifier is a symbolic representation for the name and the location of an airport, navigation aid, or weather station, and is used for staffed air traffic control facilities in air traffic control, telecommunications, computer programming, weather reports, and related services.
airport.name: Airport location identifier

patterns.doc: The Federal Aviation Administration location identifier (FAA LID) is a three- to five-character alphanumeric code identifying aviation related facilities inside the United States, though some codes are reserved for, and are managed by other entities.
patterns.name: FAA airport code (FAA identifier)

patterns.doc: An IATA airport code, also known as an IATA location identifier, IATA station code, or simply a location identifier, is a three-letter geocode designating many airports and metropolitan areas around the world, defined by the International Air Transport Association (IATA)
patterns.name: IATA Airport code

patterns.doc: The ICAO airport code or location indicator is a four-letter code designating aerodromes around the world. These codes, as defined by the International Civil Aviation Organization and published in ICAO Document 7910: Location Indicators, are used by air traffic control and airline operations such as flight planning.
patterns.name: ICAO Airport code

eninumber.doc: An ENI number (European Number of Identification or European Vessel Identification Number) is a registration for ships capable of navigating on inland European waters. It is a unique, eight-digit identifier that is attached to a hull for its entire lifetime, independent of the vessels current name or flag.
eninumber.name: ENI Number

flightnumber.doc: In the aviation industry, a flight number or flight designator is a code for an airline service consisting of two-character airline designator and a 1 to 4 digit number.
flightnumber.name: Flight number

imonumber.doc: The International Maritime Organization (IMO) number is a unique identifier for ships, registered ship owners and management companies.
imonumber.name: IMO ship Number

mmsi.doc: A Maritime Mobile Service Identity (MMSI) is a series of nine digits which are sent in digital form over a radio frequency channel in order to uniquely identify ship stations, ship earth stations, coast stations, coast earth stations, and group calls. These identities are formed in such a way that the identity or part thereof can be used by telephone and telex subscribers connected to the general telecommunications network to call ships automatically.
mmsi.name: Maritime Mobile Service Identity

unpkggroup.doc: Packaging code according to UN transportation rules
unpkggroup.name: UN Packaging group

ru.doc: Код группы упаковки ООН
ru.name: Код группы упаковки ООН

vehiclenumber.doc: Number of the vehicle (vehicle plate number)
vehiclenumber.name: Vehicle number

categories.name: All measurable values (percentage, amount and e.t.c)

percentage.doc: Parcentage float number value between 0 and 100. Rarely could be greater that 100
percentage.name: Percentage
